acqinfo.p: These papers have been loaned to the University of Virginia Library by John Casey, English Department, University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Virginia, on April 29, 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This addition to the papers pertaining to short story writer Breece D' J Pancake (1952-1979) from Milton, West Virginia, ca. 1978-1999, ca. 160 items (1 Hollinger box) consist mainly of the business and literary correspondence of John Casey, acting as Pancake's literary executor. Included in the correspondence folders are letters of his mother Helen Pancake to Casey, post cards from Breece Pancake to John Casey, and letters to John Casey and Helen Pancake (in separate folders) from people interested in the life and writing of Breece Pancake.

Other material in the collection includes contracts; news clippings and printed material; a video cassette recording of a documentary entitled "Breece D'J Pancake: An Appalachian Voice"; articles about Pancake from Dictionary of Literary Biography and Appalachian Journal; royalty statements; three screenplays based on The Stories of Breece D'J Pancake, two by Jeffrey L. Davidson and one by Mark Rance; papers concerning the controversy over a poem reputedly about Pancake published in Appalachian Journal(1998 Summer) and book reviews of A Room Forever The Life, Work, and Letters of Breece D'J Pancakeby Thomas E. Douglass (1998) and Trilobites and Other Storiesby Breece D'J Pancake (1992).
